source_sentence: 說無垢稱經卷第五
translation: Shuo wugoucheng jing, vol. 5

source_sentence: 大唐三藏法師玄奘譯
translation: Translated by Xuanzang, the Tripiṭaka Master of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 香臺佛品第十
translation: Xiangtai fosi pin X

source_sentence: 時舍利子作是思惟：「食時將至，此摩訶薩說法未起，我等聲聞及諸菩薩當於何食？」
translation: Śāriputra then had this thought, "When the time for food arrives, what will we śrāvakas and bodhisattvas eat before this Mahāsattva rises from his teaching?"

source_sentence: 時無垢稱知彼思惟便告之曰：「大德！
translation: Knowing what they were thinking, Vimalakīrti addressed them, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如來為諸聲聞說八解脫，仁者已住，勿以財食染污其心而聞正法。
translation: The Tathāgata teaches the eight liberations to śrāvakas, so those who have stayed, don't let their minds be stained by food and possessions while listening to the right teaching.

source_sentence: 若欲食者且待須臾，當令皆得未曾有食。」
translation: If you want to eat, wait a moment, and you will all obtain unprecedented food."

source_sentence: 時無垢稱便入如是微妙寂定，發起如是殊勝神通，示諸菩薩、大聲聞眾，上方界分去此佛土過四十二殑伽沙等諸佛世界，有佛世界名一切妙香，其中有佛號最上香臺，今現在彼安隱住持。
translation: Vimalakīrti then entered such a subtle and tranquil concentration and aroused such extraordinary powers that he showed the bodhisattvas and śrāvakas that in the upper realms there were forty-two sands of buddha-worlds beyond this one, and there was a buddha-world called All Fine Fragrances, in which there was a buddha named Most Excellent Fragrance Terrace, which was now peacefully abiding there.

source_sentence: 彼世界中有妙香氣，比餘十方一切佛土人天之香最為第一。
translation: There's a wonderful fragrance in that world that's the most excellent compared to the fragrance of all the other Buddha-lands of the ten directions for humans and gods.

source_sentence: 彼有諸樹皆出妙香，普薰方域一切周滿。
translation: There are trees there that all produce a wonderful fragrance, which thoroughly perfumes the whole region.

source_sentence: 彼中無有二乘之名，唯有清淨大菩薩眾，而彼如來為其說法。
translation: There are no names of the two vehicles in that world, only a pure multitude of great bodhisattvas for whom the Tathāgata preaches.

source_sentence: 彼世界中一切臺觀、宮殿、經行、園林、衣服皆是種種妙香所成。
translation: All the terraces, palaces, sūtras, groves, and clothing in that world are made of various wonderful fragrances.

source_sentence: 彼佛世尊及菩薩眾所食香氣微妙第一，普薰十方無量佛土。
translation: The fragrance that that Buddha, the Bhagavān, and the bodhisattva congregation eat is the most subtle, and it thoroughly perfumes measureless Buddha-lands in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 時彼如來與諸菩薩方共坐食，彼有天子名曰香嚴——已於大乘深心發趣——供養承事彼土如來及諸菩薩。
translation: As the Tathāgata and the bodhisattvas were sitting together eating, there was a celestial named Xiang Yan - who had profoundly devoted himself to the great vehicle - making offerings to and serving the Tathāgata and the bodhisattvas of that land.

source_sentence: 時此大眾一切皆覩彼界如來與諸菩薩方共坐食如是等事。
translation: The whole assembly then saw the Tathāgata of that world and the bodhisattvas sitting and eating together in this way.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱遍告一切菩薩眾言：「汝等大士誰能往彼取妙香食？」
translation: Vimalakīrti then addressed the entire assembly of bodhisattvas, "Which of you great men can go there and get a meal of wonderful incense?"

source_sentence: 以妙吉祥威神力故，諸菩薩眾咸皆默然。
translation: Because of Miaojixiang's authoritative power, the bodhisattva congregation was silent.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱告妙吉祥：「汝今云何於此大眾而不加護，令其乃爾？」
translation: Vimalakīrti then addressed Miaojixiang, "Now, why don't you protect this crowd and make it so?"

source_sentence: 妙吉祥言：「居士！
translation: Mañjuśrī said, "Guru!

source_sentence: 汝今不應輕毀諸菩薩眾，如佛所言：『勿輕未學。』」
translation: Now, you mustn't despise the bodhisattva community, just as the Buddha said, 'Don't despise those who have yet to train.'"

source_sentence: 時無垢稱不起于床，居眾會前化作菩薩——身真金色，相好莊嚴，威德光明蔽於眾會——而告之曰：「汝善男子！
translation: Vimalakīrti didn't get up from his bed, but he transformed into a bodhisattva in front of the assembly-with a body of genuine gold, beautiful and ornate in appearance, and a radiant glow of authoritative qualities that illuminated the assembly-and told him, "You good sons!

source_sentence: 宜往上方去此佛土過四十二殑伽沙等諸佛世界，有佛世界名一切妙香，其中有佛號最上香臺，與諸菩薩方共坐食。
translation: "It's appropriate to go up to this Buddha land and pass through forty-two sands of buddha-worlds, where there's a buddha world called All Souls' Fine Fragrance and there's a buddha called the supreme fragrant dais where bodhisattvas sit and eat together.

source_sentence: 汝往到彼頂禮佛足，應作是言：『於此下方有無垢稱，稽首雙足，敬問世尊：「少病、少惱、起居輕利、氣力康和、安樂住不？」
translation: When you go there, bow at the Buddha's feet and say, 'Here below is the name of the Vimalakīrti, bow your heads with both feet, and respectfully ask the Bhagavān, "Are you little sick, little troubled, do you live lightly, have good energy, and live in well-being?"'

source_sentence: 遙心右繞多百千匝，頂禮雙足作如是言：「願得世尊所食之餘，當於下方堪忍世界施作佛事，令此下劣欲樂有情當欣大慧，亦使如來無量功德名稱普聞。」』」
translation: He distantly circled his heart a hundred thousand times to the right, bowed his head at his feet, and said, 'May I obtain food from the Bhagavān and then perform Buddha-works in the tolerant world below, so that this inferior class of beings with desires and pleasures will rejoice in great wisdom and the Tathāgata's immeasurable merits will be universally known.'"

source_sentence: 時化菩薩於眾會前上昇虛空——舉眾皆見——神通迅疾經須臾頃便到一切妙香世界，頂禮最上香臺佛足，又聞其言：「下方菩薩名無垢稱，稽首雙足，敬問世尊：『少病、少惱、起居輕利、氣力康和、安樂住不？』
translation: In front of the assembly, the transformed bodhisattva ascended into the sky - visible to everyone - and with swift superknowledge reached the world of fine fragrance in a few moments, saluted the feet of the most excellent fragrant dais Buddha, and heard him say, "The bodhisattva below, named Vimalakīrti, bowed his head with both feet and respectfully asked the Bhagavān, 'Is he little sick, little disturbed, rising and setting out with ease, his vitality harmonious, and abiding in well-being?'

source_sentence: 遙心右繞多百千匝，頂禮雙足作如是言：『願得世尊所食之餘，當於下方堪忍世界施作佛事，令此下劣欲樂有情當欣大慧，亦使如來無量功德名稱普聞。』」
translation: They distantly circumambulated him one hundred thousand times, bowed their heads at his feet, and said, 'May I obtain food from the Bhagavān and then perform Buddha-works in the tolerant world below, so that this inferior class of beings with desires and pleasures will delight in great wisdom and the Tathāgata's immeasurable merits will be universally known.'"

source_sentence: 時彼上方菩薩眾會見化菩薩相好莊嚴，威德光明微妙殊勝，歎未曾有：「今此大士從何處來？
translation: When the multitude of bodhisattvas up there met and saw the adorned appearance and sublime brilliance of the transformed bodhisattva, they praised him as unprecedented, "Where did this great man come from?

source_sentence: 堪忍世界為在何所？
translation: Where does the world of tolerance fit in?

source_sentence: 云何名為下劣欲樂？」
translation: What is called inferior desires and pleasures?"

source_sentence: 尋問最上香臺如來：「唯願世尊為說斯事。」
translation: He asked the most excellent Xiangtai Tathāgata, "Please, Bhagavān, explain this."

source_sentence: 佛告之曰：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told him, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 於彼下方去此佛土過四十二殑伽沙等諸佛世界，有佛世界名曰堪忍，其中佛號釋迦牟尼如來、應、正等覺，今現在彼安隱住持，居五濁世為諸下劣欲樂有情宣揚正法。
translation: Below that, in a Buddha-land 42 sands away from this one, there's a Buddha-world called Kannada, in which the Buddha named Śākyamuni, the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Enlightened One, now lives there in seclusion and maintains his abode in the five turbid realms, proclaiming the right Dharma for sentient beings of lowly desires and pleasures.

source_sentence: 彼有菩薩名無垢稱——已得安住不可思議解脫法門——為諸菩薩開示妙法，遣化菩薩來至此間稱揚我身功德名號，并讚此土眾德莊嚴，令彼菩薩善根增進。」
translation: There's a bodhisattva there named Vimalakīrti - who has attained stability in the gate of inconceivable liberation - who reveals the wonderful Dharma for the bodhisattvas and sends transformation bodhisattvas to this place to praise the name of my merits and the virtues and adornment of this land, which causes the bodhisattvas there to develop their good roots."

source_sentence: 彼菩薩眾咸作是言：「其德何如乃作是化，大神通力無畏若斯？」
translation: That crowd of bodhisattvas all said, "How could he have done such a transformation with such great supernormal powers and fearlessness?"

source_sentence: 彼佛告言：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told them, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 是大菩薩成就殊勝大功德法，一剎那頃化作無量無邊菩薩，遍於十方一切國土，皆遣其往施作佛事，利益安樂無量有情。」
translation: This great bodhisattva accomplishes an extraordinary and highly meritorious teaching, and in a single moment he transforms into a measureless and limitless bodhisattva who travels to all the lands in the ten directions and is sent there to perform Buddha-works for the benefit and welfare of measureless sentient beings."

source_sentence: 於是，最上香臺如來以能流出眾妙香器盛諸妙香所薰之食，授無垢稱化菩薩手。
translation: The supreme Gandhāra Tathāgata then gave the hand of the Immaculate Conception Bodhisattva a bowl filled with food perfumed by the many wonderful incense sticks that flow from it.

source_sentence: 時彼佛土有九百萬大菩薩僧同時舉聲請於彼佛：「我等欲與此化菩薩俱往下方堪忍世界，瞻仰釋迦牟尼如來，禮敬供事、聽聞正法，并欲瞻仰、禮敬供事彼無垢稱及諸菩薩，唯願世尊加護聽許。」
translation: At the time, nine million great bodhisattva monks in that Buddha land simultaneously raised their voices and asked the Buddha, "We want to go down there with this transformation bodhisattva to the world of endurance to look up to the Śākyamuni Tathāgata, venerate, serve, and hear the right teaching, and to look up to, venerate, and serve the Vimalakīrti and the bodhisattvas, so please let the Bhagavān protect us and give us permission."

source_sentence: 彼佛告曰：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told them, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝便可往，今正是時。
translation: You can go then, for now is the right time.

source_sentence: 汝等皆應自攝身香入堪忍界，勿令彼諸有情醉悶放逸；汝等皆應自隱色相入堪忍界，勿令彼諸菩薩心生愧恥。
translation: You should all gather your own body odor and enter the realm of tolerability, so that you don't cause those sentient beings to become intoxicated and dissipated, and you should all hide your own appearance and enter the realm of tolerability, so that you don't cause those bodhisattvas to feel ashamed.

source_sentence: 汝等於彼堪忍世界勿生劣想而作障礙。
translation: In that tolerable world, you mustn't give rise to inferior notions that create obstacles.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切國土皆如虛空，諸佛、世尊為欲成熟諸有情故，隨諸有情所樂示現種種佛土——或染、或淨，無決定相——而諸佛土實皆清淨、無有差別。」
translation: All lands are like space, and because the buddhas and the Bhagavān want to bring sentient beings to maturity, they reveal various buddha-lands - whether defiled or pure, with no definite characteristics - according to the desires of sentient beings, yet all buddha-lands are really pure and have no distinctions."

source_sentence: 時化菩薩受滿食器，與九百萬諸菩薩僧，承彼佛威神及無垢稱力於彼界沒，經須臾頃至於此土無垢稱室欻然而現。
translation: The transformation bodhisattva then received a full meal container, and 9 million bodhisattvas and monks, endowed with the Buddha's authority and the power of Vimalakīrti, disappeared into that world, where Vimalakīrti's abode appeared in a crashing manner in a short while.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱化九百萬師子之座——微妙莊嚴，與前所坐諸師子座都無有異——令諸菩薩皆坐其上。
translation: Vimalakīrti then transformed 9 million lion seats-subtle and ornate, no different from the lion seats they were sitting on-into seats for the bodhisattvas to sit on.

source_sentence: 時化菩薩以滿食器授無垢稱。
translation: The transformed bodhisattvas then gave Vimalakīrti a food container that was full of food.

source_sentence: 如是食器妙香普薰廣嚴大城及此三千大千世界無量無邊。
translation: The wonderful fragrance of this food vessel universally perfumes the vast, ornate city and these 3,000 great thousand worlds, which are numberless and limitless.

source_sentence: 妙香薰故，一切世界香氣芬馥。
translation: As a result of this wonderful fragrance, the whole world is fragrant with odor.

source_sentence: 廣嚴大城諸婆羅門、長者、居士、人、非人等，聞是香氣得未曾有，驚歎無量，身心踊悅。
translation: The priests, elders, householders, humans, and non-humans in Vairocana heard this fragrance like never before, marveled in wonder, and were delighted in body and spirit.

source_sentence: 時此城中離呫毘王名為月蓋，與八萬四千離呫毘種，種種莊嚴，悉來入于無垢稱室，見此室中諸菩薩眾其數甚多、諸師子座高廣嚴飾，生大歡喜，歎未曾有，禮諸菩薩及大聲聞，却住一面。
translation: When the Lixambī king of this city, who's called Yueh-Gai, and 84,000 of his Lixambī breed, adorned in various ways, all came into the Vimalakīrti chamber and saw the great number of bodhisattvas in that chamber and the high, wide, and ornate lion seats, they became greatly elated and praised as unprecedented, paid homage to the bodhisattvas and great śrāvakas, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 時諸地神及虛空神，并欲色界諸天子眾，聞是妙香，各與眷屬無量百千，悉來入于無垢稱室。
translation: When the earth spirits, sky spirits, and gods of the desire realm heard this wonderful fragrance, they each came with their retinues, numbering hundreds of thousands, into Venerable Wúschel's abode.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱便語尊者舍利子等諸大聲聞：「尊者可食如來所施甘露味食。
translation: Venerable Śāriputra and the other great śrāvakas then said, "Venerable, you may eat the nectar-flavored food that the Tathāgata gives.

source_sentence: 如是食者，大悲所薰，勿以少分下劣心行而食此食；若如是食，定不能消。」
translation: Such a meal is perfumed by great compassion, so don't eat it with a little bit of inferior mental conduct; if you eat it that way, it certainly won't go away."

source_sentence: 時眾會中有劣聲聞作如是念：「此食甚少，云何充足如是大眾？」
translation: An inferior śrāvaka in the assembly then thought, "This food is so little, how could it be enough for such a large group?"

source_sentence: 時化菩薩便告之言：「勿以汝等自少福慧測量如來無量福慧。
translation: The transformed bodhisattva then told him, "Don't use your own little merit and wisdom to measure the Tathāgata's immeasurable merit and wisdom.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 四大海水乍可有竭，是妙香食終無有盡。
translation: At first, the four great waters of the ocean could be inexhaustible, but this wonderful fragrant food would never end.

source_sentence: 假使無量大千世界一切有情一一摶食，其食摶量等妙高山，如是摶食或經一劫、或一百劫猶不能盡。
translation: Suppose all sentient beings in an infinite number of great one-thousand worlds were to take food from each of them, and their food were equal in volume to that of a marvelous mountain, such food might not be exhausted after one or a hundred eons.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如是食者，是無盡戒、定、慧、解脫、解脫知見所生。
translation: Such a meal is produced from inexhaustible morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and knowledge and vision of liberation.

source_sentence: 如來所食之餘，無量三千大千世界一切有情，經百千劫食此香食終不能盡，於是大眾皆食此食悉得充滿而尚有餘。」
translation: After eating this fragrant food, the Tathāgata's food could never be exhausted by an incalculable number of sentient beings in a world of 3,000,000 great one-thousand eons, so the whole assembly eats this food and is completely filled, yet there's still something left."

source_sentence: 時諸聲聞及諸菩薩并人天等一切眾會，食此食已其身安樂，譬如一切安樂莊嚴世界菩薩一切安樂之所住持，身諸毛孔皆出妙香；譬如一切妙香世界眾妙香樹常出無量種種妙香。
translation: It was then that the assembly of śrāvakas, bodhisattvas, humans, gods, and so forth, fed on this food, and their bodies were filled with well-being, like the well-being of bodhisattvas in the world of well-being, where they abide in well-being, and the pores of their bodies all emitted a wonderful fragrance, like the many wonderful fragrant trees in the world of wonderful fragrances that always emit an infinite variety of wonderful fragrances.

source_sentence: 時無垢稱問彼上方諸來菩薩：「汝等知不？
translation: Vimalakīrti then asked the bodhisattvas from above, "Do you know this?

source_sentence: 彼土如來於其世界為諸菩薩云何說法？」
translation: How does the Tathāgata of that land teach the bodhisattvas in that world?"

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩咸共答言：「我土如來不為菩薩文詞說法，但以妙香令諸菩薩皆悉調伏。」
translation: The bodhisattvas all answered together, "The Tathāgata of our land doesn't teach the bodhisattvas in words, but rather uses wonderful fragrances to bring the bodhisattvas into submission."

source_sentence: 「彼諸菩薩各各安坐妙香樹下，諸妙香樹各各流出種種香氣，彼諸菩薩聞斯妙香便獲一切德莊嚴定，獲此定已即具一切菩薩功德。」
translation: "As each of those bodhisattvas sits under a wonderful fragrant tree, various fragrances flow from each of those wonderful fragrant trees, and when those bodhisattvas hear that wonderful fragrance, they attain a concentration that's adorned with all virtues, and after attaining that concentration, they then attain all bodhisattva attributes."

source_sentence: 時彼上方諸來菩薩問無垢稱：「此土如來釋迦牟尼為諸有情云何說法？」
translation: The bodhisattvas from above then asked Vimalakīrti, "How does the Tathāgata Śākyamuni teach for sentient beings in this land?"

source_sentence: 無垢稱曰：「此土有情一切剛強極難調化，如來還以種種能伏剛強語言而調化之。
translation: Vimalakīrti said, "All the sentient beings in this land are extremely difficult to tame, so the Tathāgata tames them with various words that can subdue their rigidity.

source_sentence: 云何名為種種能伏剛強語言？
translation: What do they call various kinds of language that subdue rigidity?

source_sentence: 謂為宣說此是地獄趣、此是傍生趣、此是餓鬼趣，此是無暇生、此是諸根缺，此是身惡行、是身惡行果，此是語惡行、是語惡行果，此是意惡行、是意惡行果，此是斷生命、是斷生命果，此是不與取、是不與取果，此是欲邪行、是欲邪行果，此是虛誑語、是虛誑語果，此是離間語、是離間語果，此是麁惡語、是麁惡語果，此是雜穢語、是雜穢語果，此是貪欲、是貪欲果，此是瞋恚、是瞋恚果，此是邪見、是邪見果，此是慳悋、是慳悋果，此是毀戒、是毀戒果，此是瞋恨、是瞋恨果，此是懈怠、是懈怠果，此是心亂、是心亂果，此是愚癡、是愚癡果，此受所學、此越所學，此持別解脫、此犯別解脫，此是應作、此非應作，此是瑜伽、此非瑜伽，此是永斷、此非永斷，此是障礙、此非障礙，此是犯罪、此是出罪，此是雜染、此是清淨，此是正道、此是邪道，此是善、此是惡，此是世間、此出世間，此是有罪、此是無罪，此是有漏、此是無漏，此是有為、此是無為，此是功德、此是過失，此是有苦、此是無苦，此是有樂、此是無樂，此可厭離、此可欣樂，此可棄捨、此可修習，此是生死、此是涅槃，如是等法有無量門。

source_sentence: 此土有情其心剛強，如來說此種種法門安住其心令其調伏。
translation: The minds of the sentient beings in this land are so strong that the Tathāgata explains these various teachings to calm their minds and bring them under control.

source_sentence: 「譬如象馬[怡-台+龍]悷不調，加諸楚毒乃至徹骨然後調伏。
translation: "It's like an elephant or horse [yi-tai+dragon] that's sorrowful and uncontrolled, and it's tempered by inflicting pain up to its bones.

source_sentence: 如是，此土剛強有情極難調化，如來方便以如是等苦切言詞慇懃誨喻，然後調伏趣入正法。」
translation: Thus, since it's extremely difficult to tame the strong beings of this land, the Tathāgata skillfully instructs them with such painful words and kind words, and then they are tamed and lead them into the right teaching."

source_sentence: 時彼上方諸來菩薩聞是說已得未曾有，皆作是言：「甚奇，世尊釋迦牟尼能為難事，隱覆無量尊貴功德，示現如是調伏方便，成熟下劣貧匱有情，以種種門調伏攝益。
translation: After hearing this, the bodhisattvas from above attained unprecedented attainment and all said, "How marvelous! The Bhagavān Śākyamuni can do difficult things, conceal measureless noble qualities, and display such methods of taming, ripen poor and inferior sentient beings, and tame and bring them into the fold through various approaches.

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩居此佛土亦能堪忍種種勞倦，成就最勝希有堅牢不可思議大悲精進，助揚如來無上正法，利樂如是難化有情。」
translation: Those bodhisattvas living in this Buddha land can also endure various kinds of trouble and achieve the most excellent, rare, resolute, and unfathomably great compassionate effort, which helps promote the Tathāgata's unsurpassed true teaching and brings benefit to such difficult-to-learn sentient beings."

source_sentence: 無垢稱言：「如是，大士！
translation: Vimalakīrti said, "So it is, bodhisattva!

source_sentence: 誠如所說。
translation: It's really as explained.

source_sentence: 釋迦如來能為難事，隱覆無量尊貴功德，不憚劬勞，方便調伏如是剛強難化有情。
translation: The Śākyamuni Tathāgata can do difficult things, conceal measureless revered virtues, and without trouble, skillfully tame such a hard and difficult-to-learn sentient being.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩眾生此佛土亦能堪忍種種勞倦，成就最勝希有堅牢不可思議大悲精進，助揚如來無上正法，利樂如是無量有情。
translation: All bodhisattvas and sentient beings born in this Buddha land can also tolerate various kinds of trouble, achieve the most excellent, rare, resolute, and unfathomably great compassionate exertion, help promote the Tathāgata's unsurpassed right teaching, and bring benefit to such measureless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「大士當知：堪忍世界行菩薩行饒益有情經於一生，所得功德多於一切妙香世界百千大劫行菩薩行饒益有情所得功德。
translation: "Great man, you should know that the merit gained from practicing bodhisattva actions to benefit sentient beings in the tolerant world during one lifetime is greater than the merit gained from practicing bodhisattva actions to benefit sentient beings in all the wonderfully fragrant worlds during a hundred thousand great eons.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 堪忍世界略有十種修集善法，餘十方界清淨佛土之所無有。
translation: There are ten minor ways to cultivate good qualities in the world of endurance that don't exist in other pure Buddha-lands of the ten directions.

source_sentence: 何等為十？
translation: What are the ten?

source_sentence: 一、以惠施攝諸貧窮，二、以淨戒攝諸毀禁，三、以忍辱攝諸瞋恚，四、以精進攝諸懈怠，五、以靜慮攝諸亂意，六、以勝慧攝諸愚癡，七、以說除八無暇法普攝一切無暇有情，八、以宣說大乘正法普攝一切樂小法者，九、以種種殊勝善根普攝未種諸善根者，十、以無上四種攝法恒常成熟一切有情，是為十種修集善法，此堪忍界悉皆具足，餘十方界清淨佛土之所無有。」
translation: 1. to subsume the poor with generosity, 2. to subsume abuses and prohibitions with pure morality, 3. to subsume anger with patience, 4. to subsume laziness with effort, 5. to subsume disturbed thoughts with meditation, 6. to subsume foolishness with superior wisdom, 7. to subsume all flawless sentient beings with explanations of the eight immaculate dharmas, 8. to subsume all those who enjoy lesser dharmas with explanations of the right great vehicle dharma, 9. to subsume those who haven't yet planted good roots with various superior good roots, and 10. to constantly ripen all sentient beings with the unsurpassed four methods of subsuming them are the ten kinds of cultivated good qualities that are all fully present in the tolerable realm and are unmatched in the other ten pure buddha lands."

source_sentence: 時彼佛土諸來菩薩復作是言：「堪忍世界諸菩薩眾成就幾法無毀無傷，從此命終生餘淨土？」
translation: The bodhisattvas from that Buddha land then again said, "How many things have the bodhisattvas of the tolerable world accomplished that are not destructive or harmful, and from which they'll be born in other pure lands at the end of their lives?"

source_sentence: 無垢稱言：「堪忍世界諸菩薩眾成就八法無毀無傷，從此命終生餘淨土。
translation: Vimalakīrti said, "The multitude of bodhisattvas in the world of tolerability achieve eight things without disfigurement or injury, and from here they'll be born in another pure land at the end of their lives.

source_sentence: 何等為八？
translation: What are the eight?

source_sentence: 一者、菩薩如是思惟：『我於有情應作善事，不應於彼希望善報。』
translation: 1. A bodhisattva thus contemplates, 'I should do good deeds for sentient beings and shouldn't hope for good rewards from them.'

source_sentence: 二者、菩薩如是思惟：『我應代彼一切有情受諸苦惱，我之所有一切善根悉迴施與。』
translation: 2. A bodhisattva thus contemplates, 'I should take the place of all those sentient beings who are suffering and distressed and return all my good roots to them.'

source_sentence: 三者、菩薩如是思惟：『我應於彼一切有情其心平等，心無罣礙。』
translation: 3. The bodhisattva thus contemplates, 'I should be equal in mind and have no mental obstructions for all those sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 四者、菩薩如是思惟：『我應於彼一切有情摧伏憍慢，敬愛如佛。』
translation: 4. The bodhisattva thus contemplates, 'Should I subdue pride in all those sentient beings and revere them as buddhas?'

source_sentence: 五者、菩薩信解增上，於未聽受甚深經典暫得聽聞，無疑、無謗；六者、菩薩於他利養無嫉妬心、於己利養不生憍慢；七者、菩薩調伏自心，常省己過，不譏他犯；八者、菩薩恒無放逸於諸善法，常樂尋求精進修行菩提分法。
translation: 5. The bodhisattva's faith and understanding increase, and he hears the profound sūtras he hasn't heard yet without doubting or denigrating them; 6. The bodhisattva is not jealous of the welfare of others and doesn't become proud of his own welfare; 7. The bodhisattva disciplines his own mind, always examining his own faults and not criticizing others for their transgressions; 8. The bodhisattva is always without dissipation in good qualities and always seeks to energetically cultivate the factors of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 堪忍世界諸菩薩眾若具成就如是八法無毀無傷，從此命終生餘淨土。」
translation: If the bodhisattvas of the tolerant world accomplish these eight things without harm or injury, they'll be born in one of the other pure lands at the end of their lives."

source_sentence: 其無垢稱與妙吉祥諸菩薩等於大眾中宣說種種微妙法時，百千眾生同發無上正等覺心、十千菩薩悉皆證得無生法忍。
translation: When Vimalakīrti and the wonderfully auspicious bodhisattvas taught the various subtle dharmas to the masses, a hundred thousand sentient beings simultaneously aroused the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and ten thousand bodhisattvas all realized the forbearance of the nonarising of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 說無垢稱經菩薩行品第十一
translation: Shuo wugoucheng jing pusa xing pin diyi

source_sentence: 佛時猶在菴羅衛林為眾說法，於眾會處其地欻然廣博嚴淨，一切大眾皆現金色。
translation: While the Buddha was still preaching to the crowd in Āmravana's grove, the place where he was assembled was so vast and beautiful that the whole crowd appeared golden.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀即便白佛：「世尊！
translation: Ananta then even said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此是誰之前相？
translation: Who were these prior marks?

source_sentence: 於眾會中欻然如是廣博嚴淨，一切大眾皆現金色。」
translation: In this assembly, it's so suddenly vast and ornately pure that the whole crowd appears golden."

source_sentence: 佛告具壽阿難陀曰：「是無垢稱與妙吉祥將諸大眾恭敬圍繞，發意欲來赴斯眾會，現此前相。」
translation: The Buddha told Kauṣṭhila Ānanda, "Vimalakīrti and Mañjuśrī surrounded by the great people in respect and aspiration came to this congregation and showed their previous appearances."

source_sentence: 時無垢稱語妙吉祥：「我等今應與諸大士詣如來所，頂禮、供事、瞻仰世尊，聽受妙法。」
translation: Vimalakīrti then said to Miaojixiang, "Now, we should go with the great men to the Tathāgata, pay homage, make offerings, venerate the Bhagavān, and listen to the wonderful Dharma."

source_sentence: 妙吉祥曰：「今正是時，可同行矣。」
translation: Miaojixiang said, "Now is the right time to go with them."

source_sentence: 時無垢稱現神通力，令諸大眾不起本處并師子座住右掌中往詣佛所，到已置地，恭敬頂禮世尊雙足，右繞七匝却住一面，向佛合掌，儼然而立。
translation: Vimalakīrti then demonstrated his supernormal powers, caused the large crowd to get up from their original places and stand on the lion's seat in their right palm and go to the Buddha, stand on the ground when they arrived, bow respectfully at the Bhagavān's feet, circumambulate him seven times to his right, stand to one side, fold their palms at the Buddha, and stand in a dignified manner.

source_sentence: 諸大菩薩下師子座，恭敬頂禮世尊雙足，右繞三匝却住一面，向佛合掌，儼然而立。
translation: The great bodhisattvas descended from their lion seats, bowed their heads in respect to the Bhagavān's feet, circled him three times to his right, withdrew to one side, joined their palms to the Buddha, and stood in prostration.

source_sentence: 諸大聲聞、釋梵、護世四天王等亦皆避座，恭敬頂禮世尊雙足，却住一面，向佛合掌，儼然而立。
translation: The śrāvakas, Śākyamunis, and the four heavenly guardian kings also withdrew from their seats, bowed their heads in reverence at the Bhagavān's feet, withdrew to one side, joined their palms to the Buddha, and stood in prostration.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊如法慰問諸菩薩等一切大眾，作是告言：「汝等大士隨其所應各復本座。」
translation: The Bhagavān then greeted the bodhisattvas and the rest of the assembly according to the teaching and told them, "Resume your seats, you great men, as you see fit."

source_sentence: 時諸大眾蒙佛教勅，各還本座恭敬而坐。
translation: The masses then were commanded by the Buddha to return to their original seats and sit down respectfully.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告舍利子：「汝見最勝菩薩大士自在神力之所為乎？」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Śāriputra, "Do you see what the most excellent bodhisattva-mahāsattva does with his own supernormal powers?"

source_sentence: 舍利子言：「唯然，已見。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "Yes, I've seen it."

source_sentence: 世尊復問：「汝起何想？」
translation: The Bhagavān again asked, "What conception did you give rise to?"

source_sentence: 舍利子言：「起難思想。
translation: Śāriputra said, "It's difficult to fathom.

source_sentence: 我見大士不可思議，於其作用神力功德不能算數、不能思惟、不能稱量、不能述歎。」
translation: I've seen a great person who's inconceivable, whose effects and powers and merits cannot be counted, contemplated, measured, or praised."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀即便白佛：「今所聞香昔來未有，如是香者為是誰香？」
translation: Ānanda then said to the Buddha, "This fragrance that I've heard was not there in the past, so who is this fragrance?"

source_sentence: 佛告之言：「是諸菩薩毛孔所出。」
translation: The Buddha told him, "This is what comes out of the pores of the bodhisattvas."

source_sentence: 時舍利子語阿難陀：「我等毛孔亦出是香。」
translation: Śāriputra then said to Ānanda, "This is the same kind of fragrance that comes out of our pores."

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「如是妙香，仁等身內何緣而有？」
translation: Ānanda said, "What are the causes for such a wonderful fragrance to be found in your bodies?"

source_sentence: 舍利子言：「是無垢稱自在神力，遣化菩薩往至上方最上香臺如來佛土，請得彼佛所食之餘來至室中供諸大眾，其間所有食此食者一切毛孔皆出是香。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "It was Vimalakīrti's own supernormal power that sent the transformation bodhisattva up to the land of the Tathāgata Buddha, where he asked for food from that Buddha and then came into the room to offer it to the people, and this fragrance came out of all the pores of those who ate this food."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀問無垢稱：「是妙香氣當住久如？」
translation: Ānanda then asked Vimalakīrti, "Will this wonderful fragrance last as long?"

source_sentence: 無垢稱言：「乃至此食未皆消盡，其香猶住。」
translation: Vimalakīrti said, "Even if this food hasn't all gone away, its fragrance will still be there."

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「如是所食，其經久如當皆消盡？」
translation: Ānanda said, "After such a long time, will all of this food disappear?"

source_sentence: 無垢稱言：「此食勢分七日七夜住在身中，過是已後乃可漸消，雖久未消而不為患。
translation: Vimalakīrti said, "This food is bound to stay in the body for seven days and nights, and after that it gradually disappears, even though it hasn't disappeared for a long time.

source_sentence: 具壽當知：諸聲聞乘未入正性離生位者若食此食，要入正性離生位已然後乃消；未離欲者若食此食，要得離欲然後乃消；未解脫者若食此食，要心解脫然後乃消；諸有大乘菩薩種性未發無上菩提心者若食此食，要發無上菩提心已然後乃消；已發無上菩提心者若食此食，要當證得無生法忍然後乃消；其已證得無生忍者若食此食，要當安住不退轉位然後乃消；其已安住不退位者若食此食，要當安住一生繫位然後乃消。
translation: 具壽當知：諸聲聞乘未入正性離生位者若食此食，要入正性離生位已然後乃消；未離欲者若食此食，要得離欲然後乃消；未解脫者若食此食，要心解脫然後乃消；諸有大乘菩薩種性未發無上菩提心者若食此食，要發無上菩提心已然後乃消；已發無上菩提心者若食此食，要當證得無生法忍然後乃消；其已證得無生忍者若食此食，要當安住不退轉位然後乃消；其已安住不退位者若食此食，要當安住一生繫位然後乃消。

source_sentence: 「具壽當知：譬如世間有大藥王名最上味，若有眾生遇遭諸毒遍滿身者與令服之，乃至諸毒未皆除滅，是大藥王猶未消盡；諸毒滅已然後乃消。
translation: "Kauśāmbī should know that, for example, there's a great king of medicine in the world named Supremacy of Taste, and if a sentient being encounters poison that fills their body, he gives it to them and makes them take it, even though the poison hasn't been removed altogether; this great king of medicine still hasn't completely disappeared; it then disappears after the poison has been removed.

source_sentence: 食此食者亦復如是，乃至一切煩惱諸毒未皆除滅，如是所食猶未消盡；煩惱滅已然後乃消。」
translation: So is the person who eats this food, even if the poisons of all the afflictions haven't all been removed, so that eating it hasn't yet completely disappeared; it will disappear after the afflictions have ceased."

source_sentence: 阿難陀言：「不可思議，如是大士所致香食能為眾生作諸佛事。」
translation: Ānanda said, "Incredibly, this kind of food made from incense by a great person can do all kinds of Buddha-works for sentient beings."

source_sentence: 佛即告言：「如是如是，如汝所說不可思議，此無垢稱所致香食能為眾生作諸佛事。」
translation: The Buddha then told him, "Thus and so, as you say, it's inconceivable that this fragrant food produced by the stainless name can do Buddha-works for sentient beings."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛復告阿難陀：「如無垢稱所致香食能為眾生作諸佛事，如是，於餘十方世界，或有佛土以諸光明而作佛事、或有佛土以菩提樹而作佛事、或有佛土以諸菩薩而作佛事、或有佛土以見如來色身相好而作佛事、或有佛土以諸化人而作佛事、或有佛土以諸衣服而作佛事、或有佛土以諸臥具而作佛事、或有佛土以諸飲食而作佛事、或有佛土以諸園林而作佛事、或有佛土以諸臺觀而作佛事、或有佛土以其虛空而作佛事。
translation: It was then that the Buddha again addressed Ānanda, "If this fragrant food due to its unsullied appellation can perform Buddha-works for sentient beings, then there are other worlds in the ten directions where some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their lights, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their bodhi trees, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their bodhisattvas, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with the vision of the Tathāgata's beauty in form, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their transformation people, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their clothing, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their bedding, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their food, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their gardens, some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their terraces, and some Buddha-lands perform Buddha-works with their space.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由諸有情因此方便而得調伏。
translation: Because of this skillful means, sentient beings are brought under control.

source_sentence: 「或有佛土為諸有情種種文詞宣說幻夢、光影、水月、響聲、陽焰、鏡像、浮雲、健達縛城、帝網等喻而作佛事；或有佛土以其音聲、語言、文字宣說種種諸法性相而作佛事；或有佛土清淨寂寞，無言、無說，無訶、無讚，無所推求、無有戲論，無表、無示，所化有情因斯寂寞自然證入諸法性相而作佛事。
translation: "Sometimes a Buddha land performs Buddha-works for sentient beings by explaining in various terms such metaphors as illusion and dream, light and shadow, water and moon, sound, sunlight and flame, mirrors and images, floating clouds, gandharva cities, and the imperial net; sometimes a Buddha land performs Buddha-works by explaining the nature and characteristics of various dharmas in sound, speech, and writing; sometimes a Buddha land is pure and lonely, without words or explanation, without rebuke or praise, without inference or conceptualization, without representation or indication, and the sentient beings it transforms naturally realize the nature and characteristics of dharmas as a result of that loneliness.

source_sentence: 「如是當知：十方世界諸佛國土其數無邊，所作佛事亦無數量。
translation: "Thus, you should know that the number of buddha lands in the world in the ten directions is limitless, and the number of buddha-works performed by them is also limitless.

source_sentence: 以要言之，諸佛所有威儀、進止、受用、施為，皆令所化有情調伏，是故一切皆名佛事。
translation: To summarize, all the buddhas' manner, discipline, enjoyment, and generosity bring about the subduing of the sentient beings they teach, so they all are called Buddha-works.

source_sentence: 「又，諸世間所有四魔、八萬四千諸煩惱門，有情之類為其所惱，一切如來即以此法為諸眾生而作佛事。
translation: "Furthermore, regarding the four Māras and 84,000 other afflictions in the world that afflict sentient beings, all tathāgatas use this teaching to perform Buddha-works for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：如是法門名為悟入一切佛法。
translation: "Now, you should know that such a teaching is called awakening and entering all the Buddha's teachings.

source_sentence: 若諸菩薩入此法門，雖見一切成就無量廣大功德嚴淨佛土不生喜貪、雖見一切無諸功德雜穢佛土不生憂恚，於諸佛所發生上品信樂恭敬，歎未曾有。
translation: If bodhisattvas enter this teaching, even though they see all the buddha-lands that have accomplished an immeasurably vast amount of merit and are beautiful and pure, they won't become delighted and greedy, and even though they see all the buddha-lands that are devoid of defiled merit, they won't become sad and resentful, and they will experience a higher level of faith, happiness, respect, and admiration for the buddhas that has never existed before.

source_sentence: 諸佛、世尊一切功德平等圓滿——得一切法究竟真實平等性故——為欲成熟差別有情示現種種差別佛土。
translation: Because the buddhas and the Bhagavān have equal and perfected all merits and have attained the true equality of all things, they show various different kinds of Buddha-lands for the sake of maturing different kinds of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：如諸佛土雖所依地勝劣不同，而上虛空都無差別。
translation: "Now, you should know that although the buddha-lands may differ in the superiority and inferiority of the ground on which they rest, there's no difference in the space above.

source_sentence: 如是當知：諸佛、世尊為欲成熟諸有情故，雖現種種色身不同而無障礙，福德智慧究竟圓滿都無差別。
translation: Thus, you should know that although the buddhas and the Bhagavān desire to ripen sentient beings by showing them various forms of body that are different but not obstructed, there's no difference in the ultimate consummation of merit and wisdom.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：一切如來悉皆平等——所謂最上周圓無極形色威光、諸相隨好、族姓尊貴、清淨尸羅定慧解脫解脫知見、諸力無畏不共佛法、大慈大悲大喜大捨利益安樂、威儀所行正行壽量、說法度脫成熟有情、清淨佛土，悉皆平等。
translation: "Now, you should know that all tathāgatas are equal-it's called the paramount, most perfect, and infinite form, appearance, appearance, and appearance, the minor and major features, clans and dignities, the pure śīla, concentration, wisdom, liberation, knowledge and vision of liberation, powers and fearlessness that aren't shared with the Buddha's teaching, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, benefit and comfort, mannerisms, correct practices, longevity, teaching and liberation of sentient beings, and the pure Buddha land, all of which are equal.

source_sentence: 以諸如來一切佛法悉皆平等，最上周圓究竟無盡，是故皆同名正等覺、名為如來、名為佛陀。
translation: Because all the buddha-teachings of the tathāgatas are equal, their greatest perfection is inexhaustible, and they're therefore all equally called righteous and perfectly enlightened, called tathāgatas, and called buddhas.

source_sentence: 「汝今當知：設令我欲分別廣說此三句義，汝經劫住無間聽受，窮其壽量亦不能盡。
translation: "Now, you should know that if I wanted to explain the meaning of these three phrases in detail, you wouldn't be able to exhaust their lifespan even if you listened to them for an eternity and indefinitely.

source_sentence: 假使三千大千世界有情之類，皆如阿難得念總持多聞第一，咸經劫住無間聽受，窮其壽量亦不能盡。
translation: Suppose all the sentient beings in a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds were like Ānanda, who has attained the most learned mindfulness and overview, and they all lived through eons of uninterrupted listening, whose lifespan would not be exhausted.

source_sentence: 此正等覺、如來、佛陀三句妙義，無能究竟宣揚決擇，唯除諸佛。
translation: These three wonderful words of correct enlightenment, tathāgata, and Buddha cannot be completely proclaimed and determined except by the buddhas.

source_sentence: 如是當知：諸佛菩提功德無量，無滯妙辯不可思議。」
translation: Thus, you should know that the merits of the buddhas' enlightenment are limitless, and their unfettered subtle eloquence is unfathomable."

source_sentence: 說是語已，時阿難陀白言：「世尊！
translation: After he spoke these words, Ānanda said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我從今去不敢自稱得念總持多聞第一。」
translation: From now on, I dare not claim to be the most well-versed in the Sutra of Mindfulness."

source_sentence: 佛便告曰：「汝今不應心生退屈。
translation: The Buddha then told them, "Now, you shouldn't be discouraged.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我自昔來但說汝於聲聞眾中得念總持多聞第一，非於菩薩。
translation: Since the distant past, I've only said that you're the most well-versed among śrāvakas in attaining the mastery of mindfulness, not among bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 汝今且止，其有智者不應測量諸菩薩事。
translation: Now, stop right there, for those who have wisdom shouldn't measure the works of the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 汝今當知：一切大海源底深淺猶可測量，菩薩智慧念定總持辯才大海無能測者。
translation: Now, you should know that while the depths of the sources of all oceans can be measured, there's no ocean of eloquence that can be fathomed by a bodhisattva's wisdom, mindfulness, concentration, and mastery.

source_sentence: 汝等聲聞置諸菩薩所行境界不應思惟；於一食頃是無垢稱示現變化所作神通，一切聲聞及諸獨覺百千大劫示現變化神力所作亦不能及。」
translation: You śrāvakas shouldn't contemplate the realm of what bodhisattvas do; during one meal, this is the unsullied claim to manifest miraculous powers that are unmatched by the miraculous powers of all śrāvakas and solitary realizers who manifest miraculous powers for a hundred thousand great eons."

source_sentence: 時彼上方諸來菩薩皆起禮拜釋迦牟尼，合掌恭敬白言：「世尊！
translation: Up there, the bodhisattvas who had come before them all rose to pay homage to Śākyamuni, joined their palms in respect, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等初來見此佛土種種雜穢生下劣想，今皆悔愧捨離是心。
translation: When we first came to see the various defilements of this Buddha's land, we had inferior notions, but now we all repent and turn away from such thoughts.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸佛境界方便善巧不可思議，為欲成熟諸有情故，如如有情所樂差別，如是如是示現佛土。
translation: "The skillful means of the buddha's realm are unfathomable, and for the sake of maturing sentient beings, they present the Buddha's land as such, thus and so forth, with all the distinctions that sentient beings enjoy.

source_sentence: 唯然，世尊！
translation: Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願賜少法，當還一切妙香世界，由此法故常念如來。」
translation: May a little teaching be granted that will lead to the return of all the wonderfully fragrant worlds, and that will lead to constant mindfulness of the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 說是語已，世尊告彼諸來菩薩言：「善男子！
translation: After speaking these words, the Bhagavān addressed the bodhisattvas who had come, saying, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 有諸菩薩解脫法門名有盡無盡，汝今敬受當勤修學。
translation: "There are bodhisattva approaches to liberation called endowed and inexhaustible, which you should now honor and accept and diligently cultivate.

source_sentence: 云何名為有盡無盡？
translation: What is called enduring and inexhaustible?

source_sentence: 言有盡者，即是有為，有生滅法；言無盡者，即是無為，無生滅法。
translation: When it's said that there's an end, it means there are existent things that arise and cease, and when it's said that there's no end, it means there's no existent things that arise and cease.

source_sentence: 「菩薩不應盡其有為，亦復不應住於無為。
translation: "A bodhisattva shouldn't end his existent-ness, and he also shouldn't abide in nonexistence.

source_sentence: 云何菩薩不盡有為？
translation: How do bodhisattvas not exhaust their existent-ness?

source_sentence: 謂諸菩薩不棄大慈、不捨大悲，曾所生起增上意樂，一切智心繫念寶重而不暫忘，成熟有情常無厭倦，於四攝事恒不棄捨，護持正法不惜身命，求習諸善終無厭足。
translation: It means bodhisattvas don't abandon great kindness and don't abandon great compassion, they arouse superior aspirations in their past, they are mindful of the treasures of omniscience and don't forget them for a moment, they never tire of maturing sentient beings, they never discard the four practices, they protect the right teaching without surrendering their lives, and they never tire of cultivating good qualities.

source_sentence: 常樂安立迴向善巧，詢求正法曾無懈倦，敷演法教不作師倦。
translation: Always delighting in the skillful means of dedication of merit, he never tires of seeking the right teaching and never becomes a teacher who preaches the teaching.

source_sentence: 常欣瞻仰供事諸佛，故受生死而無怖畏、雖遇興衰而無欣慼，於諸未學終不輕陵、於已學者敬愛如佛，於煩惱雜能如理思、於遠離樂能不耽染，於己樂事曾無味著、於他樂事深心隨喜，於所修習靜慮解脫等持等至如地獄想而不味著、於所遊歷界趣生死如宮苑想而不厭離，於乞求者生善友想捨諸所有皆無顧悋，於一切智起迴向想，於諸毀禁起救護想，於波羅蜜多如父母想速令圓滿，於菩提分法如翼從想不令究竟，於諸善法常勤修習、於諸佛土恒樂莊嚴、於他佛土深心欣讚、於自佛土能速成就。
translation: 常欣瞻仰供事諸佛，故受生死而無怖畏、雖遇興衰而無欣慼，於諸未學終不輕陵、於已學者敬愛如佛，於煩惱雜能如理思、於遠離樂能不耽染，於己樂事曾無味著、於他樂事深心隨喜，於所修習靜慮解脫等持等至如地獄想而不味著、於所遊歷界趣生死如宮苑想而不厭離，於乞求者生善友想捨諸所有皆無顧悋，於一切智起迴向想，於諸毀禁起救護想，於波羅蜜多如父母想速令圓滿，於菩提分法如翼從想不令究竟，於諸善法常勤修習、於諸佛土恒樂莊嚴、於他佛土深心欣讚、於自佛土能速成就。

source_sentence: 「為諸相好圓滿莊嚴，修行清淨無礙大施；為身語心嚴飾清淨，遠離一切犯戒惡法；為令身心堅固堪忍，遠離一切忿恨煩惱；為令所修速得究竟，經劫無數生死流轉；為令自心勇猛堅住，聽佛無量功德不倦；為欲永害煩惱怨敵，方便修治般若刀杖；為欲荷諸有情重擔，於蘊界處求遍了知；為欲摧伏一切魔軍，熾然精進曾無懈怠；為欲護持無上正法，離慢，勤求善巧化智；為諸世間愛重受化，常樂習行，少欲知足。
translation: 「為諸相好圓滿莊嚴，修行清淨無礙大施；為身語心嚴飾清淨，遠離一切犯戒惡法；為令身心堅固堪忍，遠離一切忿恨煩惱；為令所修速得究竟，經劫無數生死流轉；為令自心勇猛堅住，聽佛無量功德不倦；為欲永害煩惱怨敵，方便修治般若刀杖；為欲荷諸有情重擔，於蘊界處求遍了知；為欲摧伏一切魔軍，熾然精進曾無懈怠；為欲護持無上正法，離慢，勤求善巧化智；為諸世間愛重受化，常樂習行，少欲知足。

source_sentence: 「於諸世法恒無雜染，而能隨順一切世間；於諸威儀恒無毀壞，而能示現一切所作。
translation: "They are constantly undefiled by worldly phenomena and are able to conform to all worlds, and they are constantly undefiled by their manner and are able to display all their works.

source_sentence: 「發生種種神通妙慧，利益安樂一切有情；受持一切所聞正法，為起妙智正念總持；發生諸根勝劣妙智，為斷一切有情疑惑；證得種種無礙辯才，敷演正法常無擁滯；為受人天殊勝喜樂，勤修清淨十善業道；為正開發梵天道路，勤進修行四無量智；為得諸佛上妙音聲，勸請說法，隨喜讚善；為得諸佛上妙威儀，常修殊勝寂靜三業；為令所修念念增勝，於一切法心無染滯；為善調御諸菩薩僧，常以大乘勸眾生學；為不失壞所有功德，於一切時常無放逸；為諸善根展轉增進，常樂修治種種大願；為欲莊嚴一切佛土，常勤修習廣大善根；為令所修究竟無盡，常修迴向善巧方便。
translation: 「發生種種神通妙慧，利益安樂一切有情；受持一切所聞正法，為起妙智正念總持；發生諸根勝劣妙智，為斷一切有情疑惑；證得種種無礙辯才，敷演正法常無擁滯；為受人天殊勝喜樂，勤修清淨十善業道；為正開發梵天道路，勤進修行四無量智；為得諸佛上妙音聲，勸請說法，隨喜讚善；為得諸佛上妙威儀，常修殊勝寂靜三業；為令所修念念增勝，於一切法心無染滯；為善調御諸菩薩僧，常以大乘勸眾生學；為不失壞所有功德，於一切時常無放逸；為諸善根展轉增進，常樂修治種種大願；為欲莊嚴一切佛土，常勤修習廣大善根；為令所修究竟無盡，常修迴向善巧方便。

source_sentence: 「諸善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 修行此法是名菩薩不盡有為。
translation: Cultivating this Dharma is called a bodhisattva not ending [the practice of] existential activity.

source_sentence: 「云何菩薩不住無為？
translation: "How does a bodhisattva not abide in nonproductivity?

source_sentence: 謂諸菩薩雖行於空，而於其空不樂作證；雖行無相，而於無相不樂作證；雖行無願，而於無願不樂作證；雖行無作，而於無作不樂作證；雖觀諸行皆悉無常，而於善根心無厭足；雖觀世間一切皆苦，而於生死故意受生；雖樂觀察內無有我，而不畢竟厭捨自身；雖樂觀察外無有情，而常化導心無厭倦；雖觀涅槃畢竟寂靜，而不畢竟墮於寂滅；雖觀遠離究竟安樂，而不究竟厭患身心；雖樂觀察無阿賴耶，而不棄捨清白法藏；雖觀諸法畢竟無生，而常荷負利眾生事；雖觀無漏，而於生死流轉不絕；雖觀無行，而行成熟諸有情事；雖觀無我，而於有情不捨大悲；雖觀無生，而於二乘不墮正位；雖觀諸法畢竟空寂，而不空寂所修福德；雖觀諸法畢竟遠離，而不遠離所修智慧；雖觀諸法畢竟無實，而常安住圓滿思惟；雖觀諸法畢竟無主，而常精勤求自然智；雖觀諸法永無幖幟，而於了義安立佛種。
translation: 謂諸菩薩雖行於空，而於其空不樂作證；雖行無相，而於無相不樂作證；雖行無願，而於無願不樂作證；雖行無作，而於無作不樂作證；雖觀諸行皆悉無常，而於善根心無厭足；雖觀世間一切皆苦，而於生死故意受生；雖樂觀察內無有我，而不畢竟厭捨自身；雖樂觀察外無有情，而常化導心無厭倦；雖觀涅槃畢竟寂靜，而不畢竟墮於寂滅；雖觀遠離究竟安樂，而不究竟厭患身心；雖樂觀察無阿賴耶，而不棄捨清白法藏；雖觀諸法畢竟無生，而常荷負利眾生事；雖觀無漏，而於生死流轉不絕；雖觀無行，而行成熟諸有情事；雖觀無我，而於有情不捨大悲；雖觀無生，而於二乘不墮正位；雖觀諸法畢竟空寂，而不空寂所修福德；雖觀諸法畢竟遠離，而不遠離所修智慧；雖觀諸法畢竟無實，而常安住圓滿思惟；雖觀諸法畢竟無主，而常精勤求自然智；雖觀諸法永無幖幟，而於了義安立佛種。

source_sentence: 以諸菩薩常勤修集福資糧故不住無為，常勤修集智資糧故不盡有為；成就大慈無缺減故不住無為，成就大悲無缺減故不盡有為；利益安樂諸有情故不住無為，究竟圓滿諸佛法故不盡有為；成滿一切相好莊嚴佛色身故不住無為，證得一切力無畏等佛智身故不盡有為；方便善巧化眾生故不住無為，微妙智慧善觀察故不盡有為；修治佛土究竟滿故不住無為，佛身安住常無盡故不盡有為；常作饒益眾生事故不住無為，領受法義無休廢故不盡有為；積集善根常無盡故不住無為，善根力持不斷壞故不盡有為；為欲成滿本所願故不住無為，於永寂滅不希求故不盡有為；圓滿意樂善清淨故不住無為，增上意樂善清淨故不盡有為；恒常遊戲五神通故不住無為，佛智六通善圓滿故不盡有為；波羅蜜多資糧滿故不住無為，本所思惟未圓滿故不盡有為；集法財寶常無厭故不住無為，不樂希求少分法故不盡有為；堅牢誓願常無退故不住無為，能令誓願究竟滿故不盡有為；積集一切妙法藥故不住無為，隨其所應授法藥故不盡有為；遍知眾生煩惱病故不住無為，息除眾生煩惱病故不盡有為。

translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 菩薩如是不盡有為、不住無為，是名安住有盡無盡解脫法門，汝等皆當精勤修學。」
translation: This is called the bodhisattva's abiding in the Dharma-gate of liberation that has neither ended existent nor inexhaustible, and you should all diligently cultivate it."

source_sentence: 爾時，一切妙香世界最上香臺如來佛土諸來菩薩聞說如是有盡無盡解脫門已，法教開發勸勵其心，皆大歡喜，身心踊躍，以無量種上妙香花、諸莊嚴具供養世尊及諸菩薩并此所說有盡無盡解脫法門。
translation: At the time, the bodhisattvas of the Tathāgata's land, the most excellent fragrant dais of the world of fine fragrance, who heard about this teaching of the liberation that has endlessly and inexhaustibly existent, were encouraged by the teaching of the Dharma, rejoiced greatly, and roused in body and spirit as they offered measureless kinds of flowers of fine fragrance and ornaments to the Bhagavān and the bodhisattvas and this teaching of the liberation that has endlessly and inexhaustibly existent.

source_sentence: 復以種種上妙香花散遍三千大千世界，香花覆地深沒於膝。
translation: Again, they scattered a variety of flowers of the finest fragrance throughout the 3,000 great thousand worlds, covering the ground with the flowers and sinking down to their knees.

source_sentence: 時諸菩薩恭敬頂禮世尊雙足，右繞三匝，稱揚讚頌釋迦牟尼及諸菩薩并所說法，於此佛土欻然不現，經須臾間便住彼國。
translation: The bodhisattvas then respectfully bowed their heads at the Bhagavān's feet, circled him three times to his right, praised and extolled Śākyamuni, the bodhisattvas, and the teachings they had explained, and then they suddenly disappeared from this Buddha land and stayed there for a short time.
